Let $p(a,d)$ be the least prime congruent to $a\pmod{d}$. Does there exist a constant $c>0$ such that, for all large $d$,\[p(a,d) > (1+c)\phi(d)\log d\]for $\gg \phi(d)$ many values of $a$?



Erd\H{o}s \cite{Er49c} could prove this is true for an infinite sequence of $d$. He also proved that, for any $\epsilon>0$,\[p(a,d)< \epsilon \phi(d)\log d\]for $\gg_\epsilon \phi(d)$ many values of $a$.




References


[Er49c] Erd\H{o}s, P., On some applications of {B}run's method. Acta Univ. Szeged. Sect. Sci. Math. (1949), 57--63.
